intro: Steganthera insignis, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its velvety, dark green leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a low-growing herb, often forming a dense rosette of foliage. Its flowers, which range in color from purple to white, are adapted for pollination by birds and insects. Steganthera insignis is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
